Sun of Faith - English: Chpater 29: Liberation of the disciples and others
Then the Bhagavan was staying on the banks of the River Nairanjana at Benares. The son of the chief lord of Varanasi named Yaśas was there.
Manual - English:
In a home, there is Yaśas (grags pa) [and] a group of women in a circle. In a second scene, in a home all women fall asleep while Yaśas opens the door and leaves. With a lamp in his hand, his father goes to look for him. He leaves his shoes at the riverside and then goes to listen to the Buddha's teaching on the other side of the river. 
     His father stands near the Buddha's teaching site. The five disciples listen to the Buddha's teaching while their relatives get ready to come to the Buddha. In a garden, there is a crowd. And there are many women with music instruments. One woman with an instrument runs away and one person goes looking for her and then meets the Buddha.

Sun of Faith - English:
The Bhagavan and Yaśas went to the patriarch’s house together,
After eating the noon meal, [the Buddha] taught the Yaśa’s mother and wife also beheld the truth.
Yaśa’s younger brothersheard that he had undertaken renunciation, so Vimala,Pūrṇa, Gavāṃpati, and Subāhu also undertook renunciation.
